title: Fantastic Beasts 2 Trailer
body:
The new fb trailer is out. And yes, it looks amazing. How I wish I could just enjoy the anticipation. #noblackmaincharacters #grindelwaldcasting

But apart from the discussion revolving around Johnny Depp and his physical abuse, as well as the complete ignoring of race issues, which makes the experience bittersweet at best, I also have a question for JKR about something that struck me really hard with this trailer: You’re a woman. Why don’t you write stories about women? Like, at all? Are you really interested in the personal background, character, struggles and life goals of men exclusively?

summary:
You know that post that says something like "if he cuts his hair and you still have a crush on him, you're in love"
What if...
body:
You know that post that says something like “if he cuts his hair and you still have a crush on him, you’re in love”

What if Charlie Weasley cuts his hair and MC still likes him….that would be cute

(I’m all for aroace Charlie W. But it’s a cute headcanon)

summary: Draco: Potter, I’d really rather you didn’t make a big deal out of this. It doesn’t mean anything. Harry: But you kissed me....
body:
Draco: Potter, I’d really rather you didn’t make a big deal out of this. It doesn’t mean anything.

Harry: But you kissed me.

Draco: So? I kissed Professor McGonagall on the hand once. Don’t think it means I’m in love with you or anything.

Harry: You’re in love with me?

Draco: See, I knew you’d make a big deal out of nothing. Are you not familiar with casual hook-ups? Sometimes a kiss is just a kiss. Sometimes sex is just sex.

Harry: So you want to have sex with me?

Draco: No, you’re not getting this. I’m not interested in being your boyfriend or whatever.

Harry: You want to be my boyfriend?

Draco: Oh, fine then. Yes. If you insist. I’ll be your boyfriend, Potter. Merlin, you are so dramatic.

tags: harry potter and the chamber of secrets
harry potter and the prisoner of azkaban
harry potter and the goblet of fire
title: The Never-ending Road
body:
Author: Laventadorn
Rating: Mature
Fandom: Harry Potter - J. K. Rowling
Relationships: Harry Potter/Severus Snape Hermione Granger & Harry Potter
Characters: Harry Potter Severus Snape Albus Dumbledore Hermione Granger Remus Lupin Sirius Black Astoria Greengrass
Additional Tags: girl!Harry Alternate Universe - Always a Different Sex Female Friendship Pre-Relationship romance pending Snape smokes it’s a magical war so some characters have to die Background Remus/Sirius background Tracey Davis/Daphne Greengrass this is pretty much genfic
Series: Part 1 of the The Never-ending Road series Next Work →
Completed: 2016-05-23
Wordcount: 557,992
Chapters: 92/92
Summary: AU. When Lily died, Snape removed his heart and replaced it with a steel trap. But rescuing her daughter from the Dursleys in the summer of ’92 is the first step on a long road to discovering this is less true than he’d thought. A girl!Harry story, starting in Chamber of Secrets and continuing through Goblet of Fire. Future Snape/Harriet. (OotP - DH will continue in a separate story.)

HERE

Scar’s Thoughts: I haven been obsessedly reading this over the last three days and I never want it to end. This is the most perfect character study of Snape (he remains a glorious abusive asshole and nothing excuses his behaviour -that old adage of explaining but not excusing is fully in force here), Remus, Sirius, and the golden trio if Harry was Harriet. The author has such a gripping style I was late to work by half an hour because I could not bear to leave a chapter unread. The whole thing is incredible. All the kudos.

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2027. Nearly three decades have passed since the battle at Hogwarts and the...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2027. Nearly three decades have passed since the battle at Hogwarts and the wizarding world continues its uphill climb towards a slow, tumultuous recovery. Danger lurks around every corner as the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the wizarding community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

blog.name: xxseverus-snapexx
blog.title: Jk Rowling Critical
blog.description: I’m done with Harry Potter. It’s been a good 10 years but I can’t do this anymore. There are better things out there.

summary: You can’t put in metaphors for racism/homophobia/classism in fantasy and expect it to communicate the reality of said bigotries....
body: You can’t put in metaphors for racism/homophobia/classism in fantasy and expect it to communicate the reality of said bigotries. Because it will always fall flat if it’s a metaphor and not the real thing. The pureblood/muggleborn issue will never compare to real life racism because it has none of the same implications and effects. Just put in REAL STORIES of racism/homophobia/classism. Metaphors cannot do justice to the real issues people face, so just use the real issues. It’s lazy writing, and frankly insulting.

reblog.comment: You can’t put in metaphors for racism/homophobia/classism in fantasy and expect it to communicate the reality of said bigotries. Because it will always fall flat if it’s a metaphor and not the real thing. Metaphors cannot do justice to the real issues people face, so just use the real issues. It’s lazy writing, and frankly insulting.

Because it will always fall flat if it’s a metaphor and not the real thing. Metaphors cannot do justice to the real issues people face, so just use the real issues. It’s lazy writing, and frankly insulting.

Because it will always fall flat if it’s a metaphor and not the real thing. The pureblood/muggleborn issue will never compare to real life racism because it has none of the same implications and effects. Just put in REAL STORIES of racism/homophobia/classism. Metaphors cannot do justice to the real issues people face, so just use the real issues. It’s lazy writing, and frankly insulting.

summary: Snape is one of the most obvious and prevelant gnc/trans coded characters in children’s literature....and yet snaters say he...
body: Snape is one of the most obvious and prevelant gnc/trans coded characters in children’s literature….and yet snaters say he represents toxic masculinity. It’s so obvious that they are projecting and trying to find any reason to hate him, even if those reasons are made up.
